message: Hi Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll really like. I'm willing to sell it to you for $110.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $105. Can you meet me halfway?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. However, I'm not quite ready to meet you halfway. I can offer you a compromise at $108. What do you think?
I appreciate your compromise, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Can you try to meet me at $105 again?
I understand that you're still a bit above your budget, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $107, but that's as low as I can go. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Can you try to meet me at $106? That's the lowest I can go.
I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I can offer you $108, but I'm not sure I can go any lower. This is my final offer.
I understand that you're getting close to your minimum price, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $106, but that's the lowest I can go. Please reconsider.
I've already made it clear that $106 is as low as I can go, Bob. I'm not willing to negotiate further. If you're interested, this is my final offer.
